content.description: Fun, short climb with a few powerful moves. Closest thing to a warm-up the Cave has to offer.
content.location: Furthest line toward the back left of the cave. Start up a few feet of low angled rock and gain a small dihedral to clip the first bolt. A few more easier moves up to the second bolt, then start to move right and up to the small roof. There is a bit of space from the last bolt to the anchors but the climbing is easy.

content.description: Interesting and thoughtful climbing down low leads to some a powerful crux and big moves up high on the cleaner face. Definitely worth doing for the 5.12 climber looking to break out of the funky trad mold of a typical Seneca day.
content.location: Left side of the cave, skirting just outside it's edge. 2nd route to the left of Predator. Start with a few technical moves up a dihedral to gain the first bolt, then follow the bolt line up and right, pulling onto the face up high.

content.description:
Old McCray project. Get inverted and get your kneebar on. This route is seriously fun, if a bit loose (in particular, there is one large block in the middle of the route). Aside from the midway block, the route seems to be cleaning up well.

The moves are more tricky than they are hard: two cryptic cruxes towards the end of the route. I think it feels about 13a, but maybe it should be given 10+ since it is at Seneca. You'll swear you are at Rifle.
content.location: Starts in the back of the cave on the right wall, ends at the Predator anchors.

content.description: This route climbs the project formerly known as the nightmare project. It was bolted by Brian McCray and Tom Cecil in the late 80's. This giant intimidating cave route fell into obscurity after the early 90's. The 2 people known to have tried it before Mike Farnsworth were Stephan Glowacz and Jordi Salas. Stephan apparently backed off due to a loose block(i couldn't find it) and Jordi worked on it for a season. Start in the back of the cave and climb "nightmare 13a" for 7 bolts to an almost no hands rest. Then continue out the roof past 4 more bolts through a difficult crux turning the lip ~ v9. After the lip stay light on your feet to reach the 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Start in the back of the south end cave

content.description: Climb predator 12a to a good rest at the anchor, then continue out the roof past 4 bolts climbing through the apex.
content.location: Start on predator on the right side of the wall
